result.execSummary:
The defendant Leandro Jude Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Count three, Per Order for Commitment signed/entry of 4/15/2016

Defendant Leandro Jude Smith in court.  Micha A. Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
The Court finds that the defendant has not been complying with the conditions of probation.  The Court ordered the defendant to serve 3 DAYS of the condition time that was stayed to today's date; the stay on the balance of the time is to continue to the next court date.  Defendant taken into custody.  Filed, signed Order For Commitment Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.

At the request of the probation agent, case adjourned for 04/15/2016 for a probation review hearing.
cab

Defendant Leandro Jude Smith in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Leandro Jude Smith in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
As to count 2:
  Sentencing proceeds.    
Upon inquiry of the Court, State advises they have complied with victim notification. Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 90 days at the House of Correction with 90 days credit.  Time served disposition.
Court found that the defendant is indigent and waived all costs and surcharges.
Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
.
As to count 3:
  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction with credit for 14 days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months, concurrent,  with the following conditions:
- Serve 60 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- The court found that the defendant is indigent and waived all other costs and surcharges.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Leandro Jude Smith in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Leandro Jude Smith in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.cab
Defendant wants to change his plea.
.
As to counts 2 and 3:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
As to count 1:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 1dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.

Defendant Leandro Jude Smith in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial.

State filed an Amended Criminal Complaint which amended Count 1 and added a Count 3: 
Count 1 amended to: Misdemeanor Battery, Domestic Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1),939.51(3)(a), and 973.055(1), a Class A Misdemeanor.
Count 3: Criminal Damage to Property (less than $2,500 damage), Domestic Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 493.01(1), 939.51(3)(a), and 973.055(1), a Class A Misdemeanor.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kremers, Branch 36.  Court reviewed the amended complaint and found probable cause. Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  

For reasons stated on the record, the Court granted the State's request for an adjournment of the 09/02/2015 jury trial date. Case adjourned to Branch 36.  Jury trial scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Victim present in court, requesting modification of the No Contact orders. Court allows for third party contact 1 time through Jane to allow defendant to retrieve mail. Victim ordered to provide Jane with mail by 5:00 PM on 6/17/2015. Defendant to make arrangements through Jane to retrieve mail from Jane.

Defendant Leandro Jude Smith in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Owen Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, State's Witness List.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

ADA Schrank contacted via telephone, stipulated to rescheduled court date. Case is rescheduled for 6/15/2015 at 1:30 PM in branch 23.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision INCLUDING ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with NEVIA C., STACI M., AND ROGELIO Q.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
